Package camzup.pfriendly

Class Yup3

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
processing.core.PGraphics
processing.opengl.PGraphicsOpenGL
camzup.pfriendly.UpOgl
camzup.pfriendly.Up3
camzup.pfriendly.Yup3
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITextDisplay, ITextDisplay2, IUp, IUp3, IUpOgl, Cloneable, PConstants
public class Yup3 extends Up3
A 3D renderer where (0.0, 1.0, 0.0) is the default world up axis.

  • Method Details

    • camDimetric

      public void camDimetric()
      Creates an pseudo-isometric camera suitable to pixel art, with a rise of 1 pixel and a run of 2 pixels.

      Should be used in conjunction with an UpOgl.ortho() projection.

    • camDimetric

      public void camDimetric(float orbit)
      Creates an pseudo-isometric camera suitable to pixel art, with a rise of 1 pixel and a run of 2 pixels.

      Should be used in conjunction with an UpOgl.ortho() projection.
      Parameters:
      orbit - camera orbit magnitude

    • camDimetric

      public void camDimetric(float xCenter, float yCenter, float zCenter, float orbit)
      Creates an pseudo-isometric camera suitable to pixel art, with a rise of 1 pixel and a run of 2 pixels. The resulting angle from atan2(1.0, 2.0), approximately 25.565 degrees, is subtracted from 60 degrees to get 33.435 degrees. This pitch, along with a yaw of 45 degrees, determines the camera's forward axis.

      Should be used in conjunction with an UpOgl.ortho() projection.
      Parameters:
      xCenter - the origin x
      yCenter - the origin y
      zCenter - the origin z
      orbit - camera orbit magnitude

    • camEast

      public void camEast()
      Places the camera on the negative x axis, such that it is looking East toward the world origin.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int iwidth, int iheight)
      Set size is the last function called by size, createGraphics, makeGraphics, etc. when initializing the graphics renderer. Therefore, any additional values that need initialization can be attempted here.
      Overrides:
      setSize in class UpOgl
      Parameters:
      iwidth - the applet width
      iheight - the applet height
